Package com.intellij.testFramework

Class BinaryLightVirtualFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.util.UserDataHolderBase
      • com.intellij.openapi.vfs.VirtualFile

          • com.intellij.testFramework.BinaryLightVirtualFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModificationTracker, UserDataHolder, UserDataHolderEx

    public class BinaryLightVirtualFile
extends LightVirtualFileBase
    In-memory implementation of VirtualFile.

        public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: VirtualFile
        Gets the InputStream for this file. Skips BOM if there is any. See Unicode Byte Order Mark FAQ for an explanation.
        Specified by:

        InputStream

      • getOutputStream

        public java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream(java.lang.Object requestor,
                                            long newModificationStamp,
                                            long newTimeStamp)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: VirtualFile

        Gets the OutputStream for this file and sets modification stamp and time stamp to the specified values after closing the stream.

        Normally, you should not use this method.

        Writes BOM first, if there is any. See Unicode Byte Order Mark FAQ for an explanation.

        Specified by:
        getOutputStream in class VirtualFile
        Parameters:
        requestor - any object to control who called this method. Note that it is considered to be an external change if requestor is null. See VirtualFileEvent.getRequestor() and SafeWriteRequestor.
        newModificationStamp - new modification stamp or -1 if no special value should be set
        newTimeStamp - new time stamp or -1 if no special value should be set
        Returns:
        OutputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        VirtualFile.getModificationStamp()

      • contentsToByteArray

        public byte [] contentsToByteArray()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: VirtualFile
        Returns file content as an array of bytes. Has the same effect as contentsToByteArray(true).
        Specified by:
        contentsToByteArray in class VirtualFile
        Returns:
        file content
        Throws:
